Functions Package¶

Functions Package¶

convert Module¶

RockPy.Functions.convert.conversion(unit)¶

This is a conversion table. Ask for the unit like: conversion[‘mass’] returns the appropriate conversion factor

Parameters:unit – str
RockPy.Functions.convert.convert2(in_unit, out_unit, unit_type)¶
Parameters:
  • in_unit – str the input unit
  • out_unit – str the desired output unit
  • unit_type – what kind of units they are.
Returns:

conversion factor

example

assume you want to convert a samples mass from mg to kg

sample_mass = 0.00345  # sample weight in kg

sample_mass *= convert2('kg', 'mg', 'mass')  # gives new mass in mg

>> sample_mass = 3450.0

Implemented units:
 
  • ‘volume’ [only metric units]
  • ‘pressure’
  • ‘length’ [only metric units]
  • ‘mass’ [only metric units]
  • ‘area’ [only metric units]

general Module¶

RockPy.Functions.general.DI2XYZ(DI)¶

Convert a tuple of D,I to a tuple of x,y,z. Assuming unit length :param DI: declination, inclination :return: (x, y, z)

RockPy.Functions.general.DIL2XYZ(DIL)¶

Convert a tuple of D,I,L components to a tuple of x,y,z. :param DIL: :return: (x, y, z)

RockPy.Functions.general.MirrorDirectionToNegativeInclination(dec, inc)¶
RockPy.Functions.general.MirrorDirectionToPositiveInclination(dec, inc)¶
RockPy.Functions.general.MirrorVectorToNegativeInclination(x, y, z)¶
RockPy.Functions.general.MirrorVectorToPositiveInclination(x, y, z)¶
RockPy.Functions.general.Proj_A_on_B_scalar(A, B)¶

project a vector A on a vector B and return the scalar result see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vector_projection :param A: vector which will be projected on vector B :param B: vector defining the direction :return: scalar value of the projection A on B

RockPy.Functions.general.XYZ2DIL(XYZ)¶

convert XYZ to dec, inc, length :param XYZ: :return:

RockPy.Functions.general.abs_min_max(list)¶
RockPy.Functions.general.create_logger(name)¶
RockPy.Functions.general.differentiate(data_list, diff=1, smoothing=1, norm=False, check=False)¶

caclulates a smoothed (if smoothing > 1) derivative of the data

Parameters:
  • data_list – ndarray - 2D array with xy[:,0] = x_data, xy[:,1] = y_data
  • diff – int - the derivative to be calculated f’ -> diff=1; f’’ -> diff=2 default = 1
  • smoothing – int - smoothing factor
  • norm –
  • check –
Returns:
RockPy.Functions.general.rotate(xyz, axis='x', degree=0, *args)¶

:rtype : object :param x: :param y: :param z: :param axis: :param degree: :return:
